subclusters.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
p53-Mediated Mitochondrial Stress and Senescence Theory

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: This theory emphasizes irreversible cell cycle arrest driven by telomere shortening, ROS, DNA damage, and SASP, typical of replicative and stress-induced senescence mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on adult stem cell senescence driven by telomere attrition, DNA damage, ROS, and SASP, fitting replicative and stress-induced senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescent cell accumulation with SASP and mtDNA release driving systemic aging, consistent with stress-induced senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: General cellular senescence theory highlighting DNA damage, telomere shortening, SASP, and dual roles in aging and development.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p16INK4a as a biomarker and mediator of senescence induced by stress, linking senescence to aging and inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes irreversible cell cycle arrest, SASP, and dual roles in aging and tissue remodeling, typical of stress-induced senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details senescence as a fundamental aging mechanism with SASP and antiapoptotic pathways, driven by DNA damage and metabolic stress.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on SASP as a driver of aging and tissue damage, highlighting dual roles and paracrine signaling in senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Emphasizes senescent cell accumulation and senolytic therapies targeting SASP to improve aging phenotypes.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence accumulation, SASP, and inflammaging as central to systemic aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights replicative exhaustion and stress-induced premature senescence as conserved aging mechanisms.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Integrates molecular and cellular senescence pathways including SASP and mitochondrial dysfunction driving aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescence in skeletal muscle contributing to sarcopenia and benefits of senolytic treatment.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Replicative and Stress-Induced Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence induction by telomere shortening and stress, SASP, and dual beneficial/detrimental roles.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: PAI-1 Mediated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on PAI-1 as a marker and causal mediator of senescence, linking it to aging and age-related pathologies.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Natural Senolytic Mechanisms in Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes INK4a-RB pathway inducing progressive cell death as a natural senolytic mechanism preventing senescent cell accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Mitochondrial Stress and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on p53/CEP-1 role in mitochondrial bioenergetic stress response modulating lifespan and senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Mitochondrial Stress and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes p53 regulation of mitochondrial redox balance via MnSOD and p66shc affecting senescence and aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Mitochondrial Stress and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Details p53 as a central integrator linking caloric restriction, nutrient sensing, and longevity via stress response pathways.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: p53-Mediated Mitochondrial Stress and Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Covers cellular senescence and programmed cell death pathways including p66shc influencing aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Mitotic Checkpoint Deficiency-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on BubR1 deficiency causing mitotic checkpoint failure, aneuploidy, and triggering cellular senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Genomic Instability and Retrotransposition-Induced Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence-associated epigenetic changes causing retrotransposon derepression and somatic structural genomic variation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmentally Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on programmed senescence during embryogenesis mediated by p21 and distinct from damage-induced senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmentally Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes embryonic programmed senescence with p21 dependence and roles in tissue remodeling.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Developmentally Programmed Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Highlights developmental senescence as a programmed mechanism distinct from adult senescence.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Senescence in Tissue Repair and Fibrosis Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on senescent cells' dual role in wound healing, fibrosis, and chronic wounds via SASP temporal dynamics.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Postmitotic Cellular Senescence (PoMiCS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in postmitotic cells with SASP and tumor suppressor pathway activation despite lack of cell cycle arrest.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neurodegeneration-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on tau-induced senescence in brain cells driving neuroinflammation and neurodegeneration.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Neurodegeneration-Associated Cellular Senescence Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes senescence in multiple brain cell types contributing to Parkinson's disease pathology.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Infection-Induced Cellular Senescence and Neurodegeneration Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on microbiota and infection-induced senescence contributing to Alzheimer's disease and systemic inflammation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Autophagy Decline and Cellular Senescence in Vascular Aging Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes autophagy decline causing accumulation of damage and premature vascular aging.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Stress-Induced Premature Senescence (SIPS) Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Focuses on chronic stress leading to premature senescence via energetic metabolism decline and damage accumulation.

theory_assignments.subcluster_name: Inflammaging and Senescence Regulatory Network Theory
theory_assignments.reasoning: Describes distinct senescence pathways in replicative and inflammatory contexts with novel inflammaging-specific regulators.
